moves.1. d4 Nf6: The most flexible move. I can play d5 in another move or a indian defense
moves.2. Nf3: This move do not shows the cards. White can plays c4 later
moves.3. e3 Bb7 4. Bd3 e6 5. O-O Be7 6. c3: Now, the white`s structure is similar to a Colle system. Togheter, if white plays e4, take adventage. I can allows this move, but was a mistake. Ne4 or d5 are better.
moves.8. Qe2 Nbd7 9. e4: White are a good central position, with initiative and possible attack in kingside.
moves.9... c5: I need space, but e5, stopping the white e pawn,  are better.
moves.10. Re1 Rc8: To take the c-column in case of cxd4. But me do not take that idea.
moves.11. Nf1 Qc7 12. Bf4 e5: A bad move, with idea to opening the center and put the f-rook en d8, I gives to my opponent the f5-square and weak the d5.. White has a clear adventage
moves.13. dxe5 dxe5 14. Bg3 Nh5: Ne3 are inevitable. Thus, I will have the pair of bishops
moves.15. Rad1 Nxg3 16. Nxg3 Rfd8 17. Nf5 Bf6: White weakness the kingside in a try to attack. A bad strategy. He must play Bd5, the outpost, with total control of the position, Now, I have the outpost f4
moves.19... Ng6 20. g5 Be7 21. Bxf7+: A sacrifice without another piece to attack. Best are Bd5. Now I take material adventage.
moves.21... Kxf7 22. Qc4+ Kf8 23. Qe6: Now, I will enchange material, to reduce the attack and approveach the pair of bishops
moves.23... Rxd1 24. Rxd1 Rd8 25. Rxd8+ Bxd8: A big mistake, better is Qxd8, threating Qd1+ and Bc8.
moves.30... Qxg5+ 31. Qxg5 Bxg5 32. Nc8 Kf7 33: Now, the knigth are out of the game, and the last chance to not lost is  34 c4 35 Nb5, allows the exchange.
